article.headline: Iona 98, Niagara 62
article.story: NIAGARA, N.Y. -- Mike Glover had 27 points, leading four Iona players in double-figure scoring as the Gaels routed Niagara 98-62 on Sunday for their third straight win against the Purple Eagles. Lamont Jones added 20 points, Taaj Ridley 12 and Sean Armand 10 for the Gaels (6-1, 2-0 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference), who have beaten Niagara in five of their last six meetings overall. Iona has won six straight since dropping its season opener against Purdue 91-90 in the Puerto Rico Tip-Off. Glover started the game's scoring with a pair of free throws, Ridley hit a jumper and Jones knocked down a 3 to put Iona up 7-0 early in the contest. The Gaels led the entire way, ahead by 22 points at the break and outscoring Niagara 54-40 in the second half. Scott Machado chipped in 12 assists for Iona. Juan'ya Green led the Purple Eagles (3-5, 0-2) with 25 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
